meanings.definition: To lead a dull, inactive, or monotonous life.
meanings.sent1: After finishing his homework, he spent the rest of the day vegetating on the couch.
meanings.sent2: She often finds herself vegetating in front of the TV on lazy Sundays.
meanings.sent3: The cat seems to enjoy vegetating in the sunbeam all day long.
meanings.sent4: The old car sat in the garage, vegetating away its days.
meanings.sent5: The students were vegetating in the classroom during the boring lecture.

meanings.definition: To grow or sprout as a plant.
meanings.sent1: The seeds planted in the garden are vegetating nicely under the warm sun.
meanings.sent2: The flowers in the pot are vegetating well, showing signs of new growth.
meanings.sent3: The little plant is vegetating happily in its cozy pot by the window.
meanings.sent4: The garden is full of plants vegetating and reaching towards the sky.
meanings.sent5: The vegetables in the backyard are vegetating beautifully, ready to be harvested.

meanings.definition: To exist in a state of physical or mental inactivity.
meanings.sent1: After a long day at work, he enjoys vegetating on the sofa with a good book.
meanings.sent2: During the summer break, the kids love vegetating by the pool all day.
meanings.sent3: The sloth is known for vegetating in the trees, moving very slowly.
meanings.sent4: The patient is vegetating in the hospital bed, waiting for visitors.
meanings.sent5: The cat is vegetating on the windowsill, watching the birds outside.
